description.plain: Joy Again are the kind of artists that make pop with a ticklishly cynical, wry sense of humor. The kind that inspires lore and bootleg CD singles and an air of mythic mystery. Anything you’ve heard about Joy Again may or may not be true.

body.plain: Joy Again are the kind of artists that make pop with a ticklishly cynical, wry sense of humor. The kind that inspires lore and bootleg CD singles and an air of mythic mystery. Anything you’ve heard about Joy Again may or may not be true.

songs.full_title: Looking Out for You by Joy Again
songs.title: Looking Out for You

description.plain: This song is about someone crazy in love with a girl who only sees him as a friend. Hence the “Out on the snow” meaning they are only friends. He is madly in love with her and looks after her while she is most likely taken and has no idea about his feelings. He has the guilt of having a crush on her and decides to write a song about his feelings revolving around her.

translation_songs.title: Joy Again - Looking Out for You (Traducción al Español)

songs.lyrics:
47 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolLooking Out for You Lyrics[Verse 1]
I guess I should stop looking out for you like I always do
When will you start looking out for me too
Instead of leaving me staring at my shoes?
It's just the way you're glancing at me
Something about you just makes me feel guilty for liking you
When you're with him, when you're with him

[Chorus]
This is a love song for a girl who will never know it's about her
I know it's pretty stupid, but I'm much too shy to tell her
She's beaming that smile, all the while
I'm all choked up on my own throat, I guess there is no hope
[Verse 2]
And we're walking out in the snow
I say, "I guess I should go"
And we're talking 'bout someone else
When we should be talking about ourselves
It's the same old situation, you've always got me waiting
Come on, dear, I think time's a-wastin'
Before we have to go back inside
And return to our normal lives

[Chorus]
This is a love song for a girl who will never know it's about her
I know it's pretty stupid, but I'm much too shy to tell her
She's beaming that smile, all the while
I'm all choked up on my own throat, I guess there is no hopeYou might also like27Embed

songs.title: Necromancer

description.plain:
Necromancer is the last track on EP.

It is about him being in a depression and he feels like this girl would make him feel better if they were in a relationship. But they are just friends and as time passes by they start to go separate paths and eventually he loses his chance to ever be with this girl.

songs.embed_content: Read “Necromancer” by Joy Again on Genius

body.plain:
Necromancer is the last track on EP.

It is about him being in a depression and he feels like this girl would make him feel better if they were in a relationship. But they are just friends and as time passes by they start to go separate paths and eventually he loses his chance to ever be with this girl.

songs.lyrics:
17 ContributorsNecromancer Lyrics[Verse 1]
Oh, necromancer, put a spell on me
With kisses so sweet they rot my teeth
Oh, necromancer, why are you so far away
Another day rolls by without me kissing your face

[Verse 2]
Oh, girl, won't you meet me in the city?
The street lights and corner store signs make you look so pretty
But when will you just be with me?
I'm so infatuated, I'd swim across the sea
[Verse 3]
I guess you're just fading all away
And I guess I have nothing much to say
And you can call me and tell me if you're okay
I just wish I could see you every dayYou might also like7Embed

songs.title: Winter Snakes

description.plain: Laziness is a rather prevalent theme in this song; the title “Winter Snakes” alludes to the fact that snakes hibernate in the wintertime, and are thus “lazy” and inactive during that time. The narrator seems to be trying to figure out how he can prevent himself from becoming lazy like the other “winter snakes” around him in the intro; however, by the first verse, he appears to be giving in to this urge, and this descent into laziness is continually hinted at throughout the remainder of the song.

songs.embed_content: Read “Winter Snakes” by Joy Again on Genius

body.plain: Laziness is a rather prevalent theme in this song; the title “Winter Snakes” alludes to the fact that snakes hibernate in the wintertime, and are thus “lazy” and inactive during that time. The narrator seems to be trying to figure out how he can prevent himself from becoming lazy like the other “winter snakes” around him in the intro; however, by the first verse, he appears to be giving in to this urge, and this descent into laziness is continually hinted at throughout the remainder of the song.

songs.lyrics:
22 ContributorsWinter Snakes Lyrics[Intro]
Winter snakes sleeping in the lobby
I better find a hobby or I'll become a snake too
Sneaking out the courtroom just as the judge condemns you
Life is just a brutal game that we don't want to play
I almost cried once at a homeless man in the fast food chain

[Verse 1]
Don't you know that it's alright if we don't do something right?
What is this heavy light
Overcoming me every night?
[Chorus 1]
Is it our fault if we're doomed?
Consuming me, consuming you
If you're tired, let's kick back
Lay in the sun and take a nap

[Verse 2]
Winter snakes, do you know how many times you've seen it snow?
Is it all in your head
A pretty girl in your bed?
Maybe I don't deserve
A single thing, not promising
Anything; a glimmering girl
A silver trout, a broken world

[Chorus 2]
God's great grave, a funeral
A fire full of old books
Sleeping still, are you dead?
Do you want to be? Is that all that's left?You might also like9Embed
